TopicTitle: Is there a point to closing intakes?

Articles.Content: I’ve been playing KSP for a while now and I still haven’t figured out if closing air intakes reduces their drag. The wiki says no, but its information is from 1.04. If it doesn’t, is there some other point to closing intakes?
I've heard several claims that it does reduce drag, but have never tested it conclusively myself.
I've seen it posted a few times that it used to matter, maybe pre-1.0?, but that it doesn't anymore.
Hmm, looks like I should test this. Maybe turn off one intake and see if the plane turns?
I just checked to make sure it hadn't changed recently...Makes no difference to drag whether open or closed.

9 minutes ago, Foxster said:

I just checked to make sure it hadn't changed recently...Makes no difference to drag whether open or closed. 

Yeah, I did a quick test, if there is a difference it’s insignificant compared to the drag of the intake part. The test rig seemed to list very slightly in the expected direction, but that could have come from a variety of places.
You can get a definitive answer by turning on aero physics data via the alt-F12 menu - assuming you are using a PC.
